techmeme.title: Thoma Bravo closed a €1.8B fund for European software deals, after opening a London office in 2023; the US PE firm has deployed €14B in Europe since 2010 (Financial Times)
Nasscom expects India's tech sector revenue to grow 5.1% to $282.6B in fiscal 2025, up from 4% growth in 2024, with software exports set to rise 4.6% to $224.4B (Reuters)
Bitcoin falls below $90K, its lowest level since mid-November 2024, as the rally that followed Trump's election fades; ETH, XRP, SOL, and more also fell sharply (Suvashree Ghosh/Bloomberg)
The ECMWF says its new weather model broke ground by making global predictions freely available; testing shows it outperforms other models up to 15 days ahead (Clive Cookson/Financial Times)
The EU's Court of Justice says Google's refusal to let Italian energy company Enel host an EV charging app on Android Auto might break EU competition rules (Edith Hancock/Wall Street Journal)
